item.title: AstraZeneca makes deal with White House to lower drug prices
item.description: The U.K.-based drugmaker became the second to strike a deal with the Trump administration as part of the president's push to rein in U.S. drug prices.

item.title: Macron puts Lecornu back as France's prime minister just days after he quit
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron has reappointed Sébastien Lecornu as prime minister, just days after his resignation, asking him to try again to form a government and produce a budget.
item.content:encoded:

item.description: Guard members in Memphis are operating under the governor's command — unlike other cities facing troop deployments, including Los Angeles, Portland and Chicago.

item.title: Israel says it has completed a pullback of troops in Gaza
item.description: Israeli forces have completed a pullback of troops from Gaza on Friday after Israel's Cabinet approved a plan for a ceasefire aimed at ending the devastating two-year war.

item.title: In the age of algorithms, one Irish town still does love the old-fashioned way
item.description: Most won't leave the town of Lisdoonvarna with a partner. But for a few nights each fall, they find something rarer — company, ritual and the comfort of not looking for love alone.
